root.publications: Fennig, Charles D., M. Paul Lewis & Gary Simons (eds.). 2013. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, Seventeenth edition, Ethnologue: Languages of the World. http://www.ethnologue.com. (09 April, 2013.)

child.publications: Fennig, Charles D., M. Paul Lewis & Gary Simons (eds.). 2013. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, Seventeenth edition, Ethnologue: Languages of the World. http://www.ethnologue.com. (09 April, 2013.)
child.pub-comments: Population: 1. Ethnic population: 19. Language Development: Dictionary.
child.geography: Russian Federation (Asia): Krasnoyarsk District, Turukhan area, Vorogovo settlement.

child.publications: Fennig, Charles D., M. Paul Lewis & Gary Simons (eds.). 2013. Ethnologue: Languages of the World, Seventeenth edition, Ethnologue: Languages of the World. http://www.ethnologue.com. (09 April, 2013.)
child.pub-comments: Population: 210; no monolinguals. Ethnic population: 1,490. Writing: Cyrillic script. Language use: Seriously endangered to moribund (2000 A. Kibrik). No other extant related languages: Arin, Assan, and Kott peoples became extinct 19th century. Home. Middle-aged or older; very few child speakers (2007). Negative to mildly positive attitudes. Also use Russian [rus]. Language Development: Taught in 5 schools. Dictionary. Grammar.
child.geography: Russian Federation (Asia): Central Russia: Upper Yenisei valley, Krasnoyarski District, Turukhansk, and Baikitsk regions; Sulomai, Bakhta, Verkhneimbatsk, Kellog, Kangatovo, Surgutikha, Vereshchagino, Baklanikha, Farkovo, Goroshikha, and Maduyka villages; eastern Siberia, east of Khanti [kca] and Mansi [mns] language areas.
